image.altText: Kamala Harris claps on stage at Democratic National Convention

props.synopsis: US Vice-President Kamala Harris will close out the Democratic National Convention with one of the biggest speeches of her career so far when she accepts her party's nomination. Follow live.

title.children: Kamala Harris promises to be a president 'for all Americans' during star-studded Democratic convention

image.altText: A black sign with 'CFMEU Victoria' written on it, hanging on a construction site.

props.synopsis: The construction arm of the embattled CFMEU has been forced into administration effective immediately, terminating the employment of more than 270 paid union officials.

title.children: Hundreds of CFMEU officials out of work as union officially placed under administration

props.synopsis: The Reserve Bank of Australia is a step closer to its biggest restructure in three decades after the treasurer offers an assurance to his Coalition counterpart.

title.children: Chalmers promises RBA board won't be turfed out, in a bid to win Coalition support for overhaul

image.altText: A transgender woman walks past photographs outside a court house.

props.synopsis: The exclusion of a transgender woman from a female-only app constituted unlawful discrimination due to gender identity, according to a landmark Federal Court ruling.

title.children: Transgender woman's exclusion from female-only app was unlawful, judge finds

image.altText: A map showing the location of an earthquake in NSW.

props.synopsis: The epicentre was in the Wollemi National Park, according to Geoscience Australia.

title.children: Breaking: Magnitude 4.8 earthquake rattles large parts of NSW

image.altText: Women in white coats holding candles

props.synopsis: It's something exhausted doctors do every day – find a quiet corner of the hospital for a quick nap. But in India, it ended in a brutal murder. Will it change a nation? WARNING: The details in this story might be distressing to some readers.

title.children: An exhausted female doctor took a nap at work. What happened next has horrified India

image.altText: Anthony Albanese grimaces while looking across the table at Peter Dutton as he speaks

props.synopsis: The battle between Donald Trump and Kamala Harris showcases the differences between America's presidential and Australia's Westminster systems, and the contrasts in money, campaigning and razzamatazz.

title.children: Unlike the US, political star power is absent in Australia, likely for the better

image.altText: A time lapse video of a button battery burning the body after being injested.

props.synopsis: A new study reveals the horrific injuries suffered after swallowing or inserting button batteries but manufacturers aren't prioritising their redesign.

title.children: Academics, parents call for redesign of deadly button batteries

image.altText: A middle-aged bald man in a suit smiles as he walks down a corridor with an ABC News logo behind him.

props.synopsis: At 18, David Anderson took a job changing tea towels and sorting mail at the ABC — 35 years later, he's set to bow out as managing director.

title.children: From mailroom to managing director, David Anderson restored 'stability' at ABC

image.altText: Operation Prosperity Guardian

props.synopsis: Defence confirms Australia will take command of an international taskforce to protect shipping lanes in the Red Sea, though it will not deploy any ships for the operation.

title.children: Australia to take command of international taskforce protecting Red Sea shipping lanes

image.altText: A Caucasian couple in their garden looking serious

props.synopsis: It's one of the largest settlements involving an IVF clinic, and is likely to put reproductive technology providers under the microscope. But observers of the industry are divided on whether this outcome will result in wider change.

title.children: Monash IVF has settled a class action lawsuit with $56m. What does it mean for reproductive providers?

image.altText: Someone holding up a diamond roughly half the size of a human palm

props.synopsis: A 2,492 carat diamond recovered from a mine in central Botswana is the largest ever found in the country and potentially the second largest in the world.

title.children: Biggest diamond in a century found at Botswana mine

image.altText: A group of footballers in yellow and brown jerseys celebrate on a footy field.

props.synopsis: Industrial action by Tasmania's electrical workers union is threatening to spike tomorrow's crucial AFL clash at York Park.

title.children: Union pay dispute threatens to throw crucial AFL clash into chaos

image.altText: Bunbury tornado homes destroyed

props.synopsis: In a blink of an eye, a freak tornado wreaked havoc and destruction on the coastal community of Bunbury. Repairs are well underway, but the emotional wounds of the terrifying experience are likely to stay with locals for decades to come.

title.children: It took 10 minutes for a freak storm to inflict chaos on this town. Three weeks later it happened again

image.altText: Someone places a bet and hands over cash at the Melbourne Cup.

props.synopsis: Tabcorp has been hit with it's biggest ever fine by the Victorian regulator and is now calling for all gambling ads to be banned from free-to-air TV.

title.children: Australian gambling giant fined $4.6m for code breaches in Victoria

image.altText: Modi in a white long shirt and vest shakes hands with Zelenskyy in green army clothes in front of a meeting table

props.synopsis: India's trade and defence relationship with Russia means it has stayed out of commenting on Vladimir Putin's invasion of Ukraine — for the most part.

title.children: Modi's visit to Ukraine is complicated, not just because of his hug with Putin

image.altText: A reflection of people walking past the ASX indicator board.

props.synopsis: The Australian share market is trading lower on Friday, following Wall Street's retreat overnight, while Treasurer Jim Chalmers says an overhaul of the Reserve Bank has been stalled for "too long". Follow live.

title.children: Australian shares follow Wall Street lower, Chalmers says RBA reform has been 'dragging for too long'

image.altText: Mike Lynch smiles as he wears a suit and walks from the High Court.

props.synopsis: The Italian coastguard say the body of Mike Lynch has been recovered from the wreckage of a superyacht.

title.children: Manufacturer blames 'unreasonable errors' for Sicily superyacht sinking as body of Mike Lynch recovered from wreckage

image.altText: two construction workers smiling in hi-vis near the shore by the ocean

props.synopsis: Kalidonis NT has been found guilty of two charges laid by NT WorkSafe over the death of a 50-year-old construction worker in the remote community of Maningrida.

title.children: Darwin company guilty of NT WorkSafe charges after violent death of employee

image.altText: A security officer draws a gun as bodies lie on the ground and people run

props.synopsis: Each time the Secret Service fails, it learns and adapts to keep its "protectees" safe. Can it fulfil its duties of keeping wannabe presidents Donald Trump and Kamala Harris safe in the lead up to the US election?

title.children: As the US election draws closer, can the Secret Service keep Trump and Harris safe?

image.altText: Two corflute signs side-by-side on the ground, showing the faces of NT politicians Eva Lawler and Lia Finocchiaro.

props.synopsis: With polls closing tomorrow, the NT election race has been dominated by a single issue — crime. But the campaign to win government for the next four years has taken some surprising turns.

title.children: Crime dominates NT election campaign featuring curfew, police apology

image.altText: Two men wearing hard hats and hi-visibility walk into the opening of a large tunnel, several times their height.

props.synopsis: After delays, multi-billion-dollar cost blowouts and a disappointing performance by boring machine Florence, Snowy Hydro picks up an additional boring machine hoping to make sure the project can be completed on time.

title.children: Snowy Hydro buys another boring machine, hoping to make up for lost time

image.altText: People wear blood-splattered, white gowns and blue masks

props.synopsis: Australian Uyghurs want sanctions against Beijing as a report finds China has imposed 4.4 million years of cumulative imprisonment on members of the mostly Muslim ethnic group.

title.children: China's jailing of Muslims continues — and 'every Uyghur' in Australia knows someone who's missing

image.altText: Hannah McGlade pictured looking pensive in a portrait taken outdoors.

props.synopsis: Experts are urging the Family, Domestic and Sexual Violence Commission to appoint an Aboriginal family violence commissioner

title.children: 'Engagement hasn't been very good': Indigenous women critical of violence prevention review

image.altText: Three women and three men pose for a photo around a TV studio desk.

props.synopsis: After five years, thousands of coffees, and more early-morning alarms than you could poke a stick at, Lisa Millar is farewelling News Breakfast.

title.children: Lisa Millar's reflections on switching off the News Breakfast alarm one last time

image.altText: A young woman with long brown hair wearing stares into the distance

props.synopsis: Tess Hansen is among an increasing number of people being diagnosed with POTS — a condition associated with long COVID — but experts say doctors are not being taught enough about it, leading to long periods of confusion and under-treatment.

title.children: POTS cases are rapidly on the rise, but diagnosing it takes years

image.altText: Andrew Tate 2

props.synopsis: Social media personality Andrew Tate is implicated in another human trafficking case, along with his brother Tristan and four others.

title.children: Andrew Tate placed under house arrest in Romania amid fresh human trafficking allegations

image.altText: Matthew Cowdrey took his personal medal tally to 17, with a gold in the S9 100m backstroke.

props.synopsis: Former Paralympic champion turned Liberal MP, Matt Cowdrey, is accusing the SA government of failing to adequately support a pre-games appeal, labelling the situation "bitterly disappointing" and urging the premier to "have a heart" — but the government says it has made a "very strong contribution".

title.children: Australia's most decorated Paralympian slams SA government pre-games funding as 'absolute disgrace'

image.altText: A large group of protesters holding signs in a car park.

props.synopsis: Hundreds of people have turned out to voice their concerns on a range of issues as Victorian Premier Jacinta Allan prepares to address the Rural Press Club of Victoria.

title.children: Hundreds of protesters turn out for speaking event featuring Victorian premier

image.altText: Red and orange glowing hot lava silhouettes a volcano in darkness.

props.synopsis: Spectacular pictures have emerged of a volcano in southwestern Iceland erupting for the sixth time since December. Nearly 4,000 locals have been mostly evacuated since November.

title.children: WATCH: Volcano in southwestern Iceland spews lava in overnight eruption

image.altText: a collection of older video game consoles

props.synopsis: As technology evolves at a lightning pace, video games that are only a few years old are already being lost. But Australia is leading the way in preserving this important cultural heritage.

title.children: Video game history is at risk of being lost, but Australia is leading the way in saving it

image.altText: Kaitlyn holding Wylder and pinching his cheeks, next to Keanu

props.synopsis: A day after arriving in hospital, Kaitlyn and her partner had a newborn baby in what's known as a cryptic pregnancy.

title.children: Perth couple unaware they were having a baby until mum was in labour at 37 weeks

image.altText: Kelis outside with abandoned boats behind her and a body of water and rocks. She has long back hair and a tight black outfit on

props.synopsis: Kelis speaks to ABC News from Kenya, where the musician, farmer, chef, and author has bought farmland. The star, whose track Milkshake is a pop culture phenomenon, is headed to Australia for BIGSOUND and Sweet Relief!

title.children: Kelis was planning to visit Kenya for a month. After the better part of a year, she's still there and has bought farmland
